title: Mark Leafa
text:
Mark Vaiao (formerly Mark Leafa) (born 4 December 1980) is a former <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Samoa</a> international <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played as a or in the 1990s and 2000s. 
He played at club level for the <a href="Otahuhu%20Leopards">Otahuhu Leopards</a> (junior), <a href="Canterbury-Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury Bulldogs</a>, <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a>, <a href="Eastern%20Suburbs%20Tigers">Easts Tigers</a>, <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a>, <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh Centurions</a>, <a href="Wynnum%20Manly%20Seagulls">Wynnum Manly</a> in the <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a>, <a href="Whitehaven%20R.L.F.C.">Whitehaven</a>, <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford Tigers</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Castleford%20Tigers%20players">Heritage № 868</a>) and the <a href="Norths%20Devils">Norths Devils</a> in the <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a>.
Playing career.
International career.
Vaiao played for <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Samoa</a> at the <a href="2000%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2000 World Cup</a>, he was named in the <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team%232008%20World%20Cup%20squad">Samoa training squad</a> for the <a href="2008%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2008 World Cup</a> but did not make the final side.
Personal life.
Vaiao is married to Jayne Vaiao.
